name: A. Chores
statement:
Petya and Vasya are brothers. Today is a special day for them as their
parents left them home alone and commissioned them to do chores. Each
chore is characterized by a single parameter its complexity. The
complexity of the -th chore equals .As Petya is older, he wants to take
the chores with complexity larger than some value () to leave to Vasya
the chores with complexity less than or equal to (). The brothers have
already decided that Petya will do exactly chores and Vasya will do
exactly chores ().In how many ways can they choose an integer so that
Petya got exactly chores and Vasya got exactly chores?
